News.Title: Delhi High Court Disposes Legal Cases in Land Dispute
News.Summary: Delhi High Court has disposed two legal cases involving Tata Communications and DLF regarding a land dispute in Greater Kailash, with final ruling scheduled for January 23, 2026.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties Q3FY26 Loss Widens to ₹323.58 Cr
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties India Limited reported a net loss of ₹323.58 crores for Q3FY26, wider than ₹232.39 crores in Q3FY25, despite revenue growth to ₹25.55 crores.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties clarifies volume spurt
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties India Limited confirms no pending material disclosures following stock exchange inquiry about unusual trading volume on December 26, 2025.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties Shifts Registered Office
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties India Limited announces relocation of its registered office within New Delhi, effective December 17, 2025, from Nirman Bhawan to Sankalp Bhawan as approved by Board of Directors.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties India Reports Quarterly Results and Receives Land Sale Approval
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties India Limited's Board of Directors approved unaudited standalone financial results for the quarter ended September 30, 2025. The company allotted 7.5 crore cumulative redeemable preference shares worth Rs 75 crore to its promoter, the President of India acting through the Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs. The Office of the Collector, Pune, Maharashtra approved the sale of Bopkhel land parcel for a premium of Rs 130.56 crore, which has been recognized as inventory improvement. The auditors noted the company has not complied with provisions regarding appointment of independent directors and highlighted a provision for stamp duty payable of Rs 651 crore for land registration across states.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties Shares Drop 18% After Failed Land Auction in Pune
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties shares fell up to 18% to Rs 151.45 from Friday's closing of Rs 184 after the company announced it received no bids for its e-auction of land parcels in Pune that concluded on October 3, 2025. The company had received approval from the Pune Collector to sell the land for Rs 130.56 crore on September 26, 2025, with the auction running from October 1-3. Hemisphere Properties is a Central Public Sector Enterprise with the President of India as majority shareholder through the Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs, formed to monetize surplus land from the 2002 VSNL disinvestment. The Pune asset, part of a 524-acre holding across Bopkhel, Dighi, Kalas and Bhosari in the Pune Metropolitan Region, is central to the company's value-unlock strategy to convert non-revenue land into income-generating assets. The stock has declined almost 20% over the past 12 months.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties India Ltd Schedules E-Auction for Pune Land Parcel After ₹130.56 Crore Payment
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties India Ltd announced an e-auction for a land parcel in Pune scheduled from October 1-3, 2025. The Pune Collector has approved the sale following a payment of ₹130.56 crore by the company.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties India Gets Approval for Bopkhel Land Sale with ₹130.56 Crore Premium
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties India Limited received approval from the Collector of Pune, Maharashtra for the sale of the Bopkhel land parcel. The approval comes with a requirement to pay a premium of ₹130.56 crore and comply with certain terms and conditions. The approval was granted through a letter dated September 26, 2025.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties Board Approves Amendment to Land Sale RFP and Extends E-Auction Date
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties India Limited's Board of Directors approved Amendment No. 2 to the Request for Proposal (RFP) document for the sale of land parcels located at Village Bopkhel, Pune, Maharashtra. The board also extended the e-auction date by 15 days from the previously scheduled date of September 15-16, 2025. The board meeting was held from 4:00 p.m. to 5:30 p.m. The amended RFP document will be made available on the company's websites at https://hpil.enivida.com and www.hpil.co.in.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties India Extends Land Auction Date by 15 Days, Amends RFP Document
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties India Limited's Board of Directors approved Amendment No. 2 to the Request for Proposal (RFP) document for the sale of land parcels at Village Bopkhel, Pune, Maharashtra. The company extended the e-auction date by 15 days from the originally scheduled dates of September 15-16, 2025. The amended RFP document will be made available on the company's websites. This follows earlier communications from December 2024 and April 2025 regarding the RFP issuance for the land sale.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties India Reports Loss of ₹264.29 Lakhs in Latest Quarterly Results
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties India Limited's Board approved unaudited standalone financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported a net loss of ₹264.29 lakhs compared to a loss of ₹209.84 lakhs in the same quarter last year. Revenue from operations increased to ₹23.86 lakhs from ₹19.68 lakhs year-over-year, while total income decreased to ₹159.15 lakhs from ₹199.01 lakhs. Total expenses rose to ₹423.44 lakhs from ₹408.85 lakhs. Basic and diluted earnings per share were negative at ₹0.09. The auditors issued a limited review report with an unmodified opinion but noted compliance issues regarding independent director appointments and highlighted provisions for stamp duty liability of ₹64,009.68 lakhs and unrecognized property tax liabilities for Chennai land parcels.

News.Title: Hemisphere Properties Approves CRPS Allotment and Amends Pune Land Sale RFP
News.Summary: Hemisphere Properties has approved the allotment of Rs 50 crore Cumulative Redeemable Preference Shares (CRPS) to the government. Additionally, the company has amended the Request for Proposal (RFP) for land sale in Pune.

News.Title: Government to Revamp National Land Monetization Corp by December
News.Summary: The Indian government plans to optimize operations and restructure the management of the National Land Monetization Corporation (NLMC) by December. NLMC is responsible for facilitating strategic disinvestment or closure of loss-making public sector units. Currently, it is assisting Bharat Sanchar Nigam Ltd. (BSNL) and Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Ltd. (MTNL) in monetizing their land assets.
